str2: The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Jewish. From Iouda; Judaean, i.e. Belonging to Jehudah.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From a derivative of echo; a throng; by implication, the rabble; by extension, a class of people; figuratively, a riot.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Genitive Masculine Plural
str2: From pro and ballo; to throw forward, i.e. Push to the front, germinate.
From the same as alektor and aner; man-defender; Alexander, the name of three Israelites and one other man.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: From sun and bibazo (by reduplication) of the base of basis); to drive together, i.e. Unite, to infer, show, teach.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.
From the same as alektor and aner; man-defender; Alexander, the name of three Israelites and one other man.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: From kata and seio; to sway downward, i.e. Make a signal.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To will, wish, desire, be willing, intend, design.

parse: Verb - Present Infinitive Middle or Passive
str2: To give a defense, defend myself (especially in a law court): it can take an object of what is said in defense.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
